description: Over 80% of computers run Microsoft Operating systems [reference]. As a result, the Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate is one of the first steps for those seeking to start a technical career. The MCSA: Windows 8 covers topics that are “must know” for anyone responsible for deploying, maintaining and supporting Windows desktops in a corporate or enterprise environment. Most people know how to use Windows in a home environment. However, there are many features under the hood that are designed for environments with a large quantity of computers. The MCSA dives in to those and gives the learner a whole new toolbox for ensuring their computing environment is functional and stable.
name: MCSA Windows 8.1 - 70-687
subtitle: Configuring Windows 8.1

episodes.description: Over 80% of computers run Microsoft Operating systems [reference]. As a result, the Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate is one of the first steps for those seeking to start a technical career. The MCSA: Windows 8 covers topics that are “must know” for anyone responsible for deploying, maintaining and supporting Windows desktops in a corporate or enterprise environment. Most people know how to use Windows in a home environment. However, there are many features under the hood that are designed for environments with a large quantity of computers. The MCSA dives in to those and gives the learner a whole new toolbox for ensuring their computing environment is functional and stable.
episodes.title: Overview of MCSA Windows 8.1 (70-687)
episodes.transcript:
1
00:00:00,000 --> 00:00:08,487
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:08,487 --> 00:00:13,575
This show on ITProTV covers
the Microsoft 70-687 exam,

3
00:00:13,575 --> 00:00:17,720
which is for the, the Windows 8 MCSA.

4
00:00:17,720 --> 00:00:22,170
The MCSA is the MIcrosoft certified
solutions associate and it's designed to

5
00:00:22,170 --> 00:00:26,250
be a mid level certification for I.T.
Systems Administrators.

6
00:00:26,250 --> 00:00:30,278
If you work in an environment where
you support Windows 8 desktops or

7
00:00:30,278 --> 00:00:35,400
Windows 8 machines just deployed in
any manner inside your organization.

8
00:00:35,400 --> 00:00:37,970
Well, that's what this
certification is designed for.

9
00:00:37,970 --> 00:00:41,180
There is more than one MCSA
that's out there though.

10
00:00:41,180 --> 00:00:43,470
There is the MCSA for
desktop infrastructure,

11
00:00:43,470 --> 00:00:44,860
which is what pertains to Windows 8.

12
00:00:44,860 --> 00:00:47,680
There's also the MCSA for
server infrastructure,

13
00:00:47,680 --> 00:00:50,124
which pertains to Windows Server 2012.

14
00:00:50,124 --> 00:00:52,776
So you have to make sure you're
going down the right track for

15
00:00:52,776 --> 00:00:56,380
your certification based on the job
role that you're going to perform.

16
00:00:56,380 --> 00:01:00,050
So if you're someone who works
on servers quite a bit well,

17
00:01:00,050 --> 00:01:01,440
the 7687 exam is not, necessarily,

18
00:01:01,440 --> 00:01:05,510
one that's going to line up with
the certifications you need to pursue.

19
00:01:05,510 --> 00:01:07,700
So before we dive into
this one specifically,

20
00:01:07,700 --> 00:01:09,890
let's just take a look at that full track.

21
00:01:09,890 --> 00:01:11,590
I've got pulled up here
Microsoft's website for

22
00:01:11,590 --> 00:01:13,430
the Microsoft Certified
Solutions Associate,

23
00:01:13,430 --> 00:01:16,530
and you'll see all
the different tracks they have.

24
00:01:16,530 --> 00:01:20,655
The MCSA server for
Windows 2008 as well 2012.

25
00:01:20,655 --> 00:01:24,997
We've got the Windows 8 and Windows 7
as well as some of the SQL Server and

26
00:01:24,997 --> 00:01:28,350
even Microsoft Office 365 certifications.

27
00:01:28,350 --> 00:01:29,730
Each of these are different tracks.

28
00:01:29,730 --> 00:01:33,530
They all lead to you attaining a MCSA,
all right.

29
00:01:33,530 --> 00:01:37,260
So you really have the MCSA with its
various specializations underneath it.

30
00:01:37,260 --> 00:01:40,080
If you want to work with servers,
you'll want to jump into the server track.

31
00:01:41,250 --> 00:01:44,700
For Windows 8 though, we've got this
guy right here, the MCSA in Windows 8.

32
00:01:44,700 --> 00:01:48,510
To get your MCSA, you actually
need to complete two exams, so

33
00:01:48,510 --> 00:01:50,980
it's two exams to one certification.

34
00:01:50,980 --> 00:01:53,600
But the exams are very closely related.

35
00:01:53,600 --> 00:01:55,640
The first one is this show,

36
00:01:55,640 --> 00:02:00,652
configuring Windows 8.1 which
lines up with the 70-87 exam.

37
00:02:00,652 --> 00:02:04,270
And that exam covers all sorts
of information pertaining to

38
00:02:04,270 --> 00:02:08,000
actually setting up and
installing, deploying Windows 8.

39
00:02:08,000 --> 00:02:11,600
So how do we get our environment up and
running using Windows 8?

40
00:02:11,600 --> 00:02:16,119
Once you've completed and, and passed
that exam, you move onto the next one,

41
00:02:16,119 --> 00:02:18,286
which is supporting Windows 8.1.

42
00:02:18,286 --> 00:02:20,870
All right, now you've got
Windows 8 in your environment.

43
00:02:20,870 --> 00:02:22,200
How do keep it running smoothly?

44
00:02:22,200 --> 00:02:25,080
How do you trouble shoot issues and
resolve problems?

45
00:02:25,080 --> 00:02:27,503
How do you maintain your environment,
all right?

46
00:02:27,503 --> 00:02:31,960
And that's the 70-688 exam,
the sister course to this one.

47
00:02:31,960 --> 00:02:34,859
But let's take a look at that 687 exam,
because that's what this show is about.

48
00:02:36,400 --> 00:02:37,060
All right.

49
00:02:37,060 --> 00:02:42,005
The 7687 exam, like most Microsoft exams,
costs $150 to take, so it's not a terribly

50
00:02:42,005 --> 00:02:46,116
expensive exam, except you've gotta
take two of them to get the MCSA, right.

51
00:02:46,116 --> 00:02:48,510
So you've got about $300 in exam costs.

52
00:02:48,510 --> 00:02:51,230
That's United States dollars
your currency may vary.

53
00:02:52,480 --> 00:02:54,810
But the exam itself is
pretty straightforward.

54
00:02:54,810 --> 00:02:59,260
You can take it at any Pearson Vue
testing center located around the world,

55
00:02:59,260 --> 00:03:01,728
if you've never tested with them
before check out their website.

56
00:03:01,728 --> 00:03:06,321
Go to www.pearsonvue,
V-U-E .com/microsoft and

57
00:03:06,321 --> 00:03:10,020
you can sign up for an account with them.

58
00:03:10,020 --> 00:03:13,090
Locate a testing center near you,
there's normally one near by,

59
00:03:13,090 --> 00:03:15,580
and then you can go and
take the exam whenever you schedule.

60
00:03:16,680 --> 00:03:20,600
But for getting ready for the exam,
well that's where our content comes in.

61
00:03:20,600 --> 00:03:23,030
All right,
now who is this one designed for?

62
00:03:23,030 --> 00:03:26,440
Well, it's designed for somebody
who's gonna be working in a business

63
00:03:26,440 --> 00:03:28,590
that is going to be supporting Windows 8.

64
00:03:28,590 --> 00:03:31,840
If you're a home user, your gonna learn
about a lot of technologies in this

65
00:03:31,840 --> 00:03:33,720
show that aren't useful at home.

66
00:03:33,720 --> 00:03:36,240
In fact, will make your life
a lot more difficult at home,

67
00:03:36,240 --> 00:03:39,930
because they're technologies
designed to support hundreds or

68
00:03:39,930 --> 00:03:43,060
thousands of systems,
not to support five systems.

69
00:03:43,060 --> 00:03:44,410
Right?
You'll find that if you use

70
00:03:44,410 --> 00:03:48,610
the technologies we discuss in this show
at home, it will make things take a lot

71
00:03:48,610 --> 00:03:51,882
longer than they should when you could
have just gone and done it manually.

72
00:03:51,882 --> 00:03:55,810
All right, so we're really gonna focus
on automating and repeating activities,

73
00:03:55,810 --> 00:03:59,380
because at home, you might just
install Windows 8 on one machine, but

74
00:03:59,380 --> 00:04:02,450
at your office, you might install
Windows 8 on 500 machines.

75
00:04:02,450 --> 00:04:04,460
And you don't want to do
it 500 separate times.

76
00:04:04,460 --> 00:04:05,960
So if we can script it,

77
00:04:05,960 --> 00:04:09,680
automate it, deploy an image that
has everything set the way we want,

78
00:04:09,680 --> 00:04:13,912
it saves a ton of time and it's absolutely
worth it in a corporate environment.

79
00:04:13,912 --> 00:04:16,580
All right so let's take a look
at what's covered on this exam.

80
00:04:16,580 --> 00:04:20,110
The exam's broken up into seven
different topic areas and

81
00:04:21,110 --> 00:04:22,800
the the font here is kind of small.

82
00:04:22,800 --> 00:04:24,680
Let me zoom in on that a little bit.

83
00:04:24,680 --> 00:04:26,990
And we can kind of run down the list here.

84
00:04:26,990 --> 00:04:29,670
We start with simply installing and
upgrading to Windows 8.1.

85
00:04:29,670 --> 00:04:31,600
And I know what you're saying.

86
00:04:31,600 --> 00:04:35,600
All right Don, I pop in a disc and I click
next 20 times and we're done, right.

87
00:04:35,600 --> 00:04:37,930
That is how a normal installation will go,
but for

88
00:04:37,930 --> 00:04:41,120
this one we will cover
the automation piece.

89
00:04:41,120 --> 00:04:45,020
How can we deploy Windows 8 over the
network without even having a disc at all.

90
00:04:45,020 --> 00:04:47,780
How can we have our own line
of business applications

91
00:04:47,780 --> 00:04:50,520
all ready installed when Windows
8 comes up the first time.

92
00:04:50,520 --> 00:04:53,640
How can we make things as
automatic as possible?

93
00:04:53,640 --> 00:04:56,370
So you get a chance to see that as well
as some of the other concerns with

94
00:04:56,370 --> 00:04:57,180
upgrading to Windows 8.1.

95
00:04:57,180 --> 00:05:00,410
Then we'll see configuring hardware and

96
00:05:00,410 --> 00:05:05,530
applications, most systems have
a fairly common set of hardware.

97
00:05:05,530 --> 00:05:08,480
But there's always these extra devices
that people bring in that we may need to

98
00:05:08,480 --> 00:05:12,730
load custom configurations for, and we'll
get a chance to see how all that works.

99
00:05:12,730 --> 00:05:14,510
Next is the networking side.

100
00:05:14,510 --> 00:05:17,300
Windows 8 is a fully network
aware operating system,

101
00:05:17,300 --> 00:05:18,960
which is not really new for it.

102
00:05:18,960 --> 00:05:21,602
But that means that it,
it doesn't just support it, but

103
00:05:21,602 --> 00:05:24,092
actually expect to have
a connection to the network.

104
00:05:24,092 --> 00:05:28,270
For things like automatic updates and
easy search functionality and, and

105
00:05:28,270 --> 00:05:32,260
using your Microsoft Live ID to
synchronize account settings.

106
00:05:32,260 --> 00:05:34,390
That stuff all requires
a network configuration.

107
00:05:34,390 --> 00:05:36,910
So we'll take a look at how to set
up the networking under Windows 8?

108
00:05:36,910 --> 00:05:38,230
To get the machines to talk together.

109
00:05:39,500 --> 00:05:43,050
Then, configuring
the access to our networks.

110
00:05:43,050 --> 00:05:45,520
If we start to share things like files,
folders,

111
00:05:45,520 --> 00:05:49,700
printers, we probably wanna control who
can get to what, and who can do what?

112
00:05:49,700 --> 00:05:52,440
So we'll see some of the different
technologies that are available there to

113
00:05:52,440 --> 00:05:53,720
control access to our system.

114
00:05:54,880 --> 00:05:57,530
Then we've got remote access and mobility.

115
00:05:57,530 --> 00:06:01,230
So today we're going to learn about
things like VPNs and dial-up connections.

116
00:06:01,230 --> 00:06:04,980
Hopefully, you don't have to use dial-up
anymore but VPN is very commonly used,

117
00:06:04,980 --> 00:06:09,000
as well as other mobile technologies
like tablet computing, right.

118
00:06:09,000 --> 00:06:11,690
Windows 8 has that two different versions,

119
00:06:11,690 --> 00:06:15,910
the normal Windows 8 and
then the Windows 8 RT or just Windows RT.

120
00:06:15,910 --> 00:06:19,129
And so we talk a little bit about
that not, not a ton on Windows RT.

121
00:06:19,129 --> 00:06:22,169
But we also discuss some of
the differences with mobile platforms in

122
00:06:22,169 --> 00:06:24,500
general, like supporting battery life,
right.

123
00:06:24,500 --> 00:06:28,270
You don't have a battery in a desktop
PC to worry about, but in a laptop or

124
00:06:28,270 --> 00:06:29,150
a tablet, you do.

125
00:06:30,840 --> 00:06:33,710
Next we talk about monitoring and
maintaining Windows clients.

126
00:06:33,710 --> 00:06:37,590
Now, this is a small portion on
maintaining the clients because the next

127
00:06:37,590 --> 00:06:40,170
exam goes into great depth on it.

128
00:06:40,170 --> 00:06:43,560
And then at the very end we've got
system and data recovery options.

129
00:06:43,560 --> 00:06:46,070
When you deploy Windows 8,
you need to have something in

130
00:06:46,070 --> 00:06:49,150
place to be able to back it up, and
restore in the event of failure.

131
00:06:49,150 --> 00:06:52,090
And that's kind of how we round
off those topics as we cover,

132
00:06:52,090 --> 00:06:55,270
how to safely back up and
restore your system?

133
00:06:55,270 --> 00:06:59,620
It's really good knowledge, all of this
is, and most of it, you'll turn around and

134
00:06:59,620 --> 00:07:01,350
use in your environment.

135
00:07:01,350 --> 00:07:03,590
What I find a lot of people do
is they go through all of this,

136
00:07:03,590 --> 00:07:06,390
they learn the different options that
are out there, and then they pick and

137
00:07:06,390 --> 00:07:09,200
choose the ones they want to
deploy in their organization.

138
00:07:09,200 --> 00:07:12,420
But you don't know what to use, if you
don't know what all is out there and

139
00:07:12,420 --> 00:07:15,160
that's what this certi,
certification is designed for.

140
00:07:15,160 --> 00:07:17,070
I find that all in all,
it's a pretty fair exam.

141
00:07:17,070 --> 00:07:20,200
The, the examination contents,
it can be a lot, right?

142
00:07:20,200 --> 00:07:23,580
It's a lot of content, but
the exam's pretty straightforward and

143
00:07:23,580 --> 00:07:26,950
Microsoft doesn't normally get
too tricky on their exams.

144
00:07:26,950 --> 00:07:31,160
So if you're gonna be going to work in
a medium or large organization, and

145
00:07:31,160 --> 00:07:32,850
you're going to be deploying Windows 8.

146
00:07:32,850 --> 00:07:36,560
This is a great certification again, it's
just a great set of knowledge to have,

147
00:07:36,560 --> 00:07:39,300
even if you don't go on to do
the certification, all right.

148
00:07:39,300 --> 00:07:43,670
If your environment is all Windows 7,
it's still useful to learn Windows 8,

149
00:07:43,670 --> 00:07:46,740
because eventually you may go to it or
maybe you'll skip over Windows 8, and

150
00:07:46,740 --> 00:07:48,360
you'll just go straight to Windows 10.

151
00:07:48,360 --> 00:07:52,340
Well, Windows 10 is building off of
a lot of the Window 8 technologies.

152
00:07:52,340 --> 00:07:56,580
So if you skip over an OS,
you're gonna be behind an eight ball.

153
00:07:56,580 --> 00:08:00,810
You've got a lot more knowledge to make up
for the changes between the two systems.

154
00:08:00,810 --> 00:08:04,480
But if you learn Windows 8 in between, now
you're that much closer to being ready for

155
00:08:04,480 --> 00:08:05,240
Windows 10.

156
00:08:05,240 --> 00:08:08,480
So it's always a good idea to
learn the new operating system,

157
00:08:08,480 --> 00:08:10,590
even if they're not that popular, right?

158
00:08:10,590 --> 00:08:11,515
Like Windows Vista.

159
00:08:11,515 --> 00:08:14,330
[LAUGH] So, so we definitely
keep that in mind as we go and

160
00:08:14,330 --> 00:08:16,240
select our certifications.

161
00:08:16,240 --> 00:08:19,380
Now if you are interested
in learning about servers

162
00:08:19,380 --> 00:08:21,740
this is not the certification for you.

163
00:08:21,740 --> 00:08:22,700
This is the MCSA for

164
00:08:22,700 --> 00:08:26,150
windows 8, you need to look into
the MCSA for Windows server 2012, right.

165
00:08:26,150 --> 00:08:30,800
That's going to steer you in the server
side and maybe you want to do both right.

166
00:08:30,800 --> 00:08:34,500
It's not that many exams to go and
get the MCSA in both and now, you know,

167
00:08:34,500 --> 00:08:38,430
the server and desktop side, and
that make you a very powerful person.

168
00:08:38,430 --> 00:08:41,810
As far as being attractive
to a company to hire or

169
00:08:41,810 --> 00:08:43,660
just being able to
support the environment.

170
00:08:43,660 --> 00:08:46,590
You'll better understand
the interaction between client and, and

171
00:08:46,590 --> 00:08:49,710
server if you know
the configurations of both, right.

172
00:08:49,710 --> 00:08:51,230
So there's a lot of
benefits doing both sides.

173
00:08:52,400 --> 00:08:55,040
All right, so
if that sounds like what you wanna learn,

174
00:08:55,040 --> 00:08:57,930
the certification you're looking to get,
then you're in the right place.

175
00:08:57,930 --> 00:08:58,640
Stay tuned.

176
00:08:58,640 --> 00:09:01,910
We'll have more Windows 8
episodes coming up soon.

177
00:09:01,910 --> 00:09:05,750
But if you're looking for servers or
if you're just starting in IT, right.

178
00:09:05,750 --> 00:09:07,710
You haven't even gotten your feet wet yet.

179
00:09:07,710 --> 00:09:09,420
This isn't the greatest starting point for
you.

180
00:09:09,420 --> 00:09:12,960
You're looking to learn about servers,
there's the MCSA for Windows Server.

181
00:09:12,960 --> 00:09:16,720
And if you're just getting started,
well you might want to take a look

182
00:09:16,720 --> 00:09:20,580
at our Microsoft Technology Associate,
the MTA certification.

183
00:09:20,580 --> 00:09:24,920
It starts out with Windows 7 and covers
the basic of operating system deployment.

184
00:09:24,920 --> 00:09:29,470
Is a much better place to start at if
this is your first IT Certification.

185
00:09:29,470 --> 00:09:33,130
However, the MTA knowledge is,
is pretty basic.

186
00:09:33,130 --> 00:09:35,220
So if you've working with Windows for
a little while,

187
00:09:35,220 --> 00:09:36,950
you might get kind of bored in that one.

188
00:09:36,950 --> 00:09:40,550
And you certainly are able to just skip
over it and come straight to the MCSA.

189
00:09:40,550 --> 00:09:43,760
That's what a lot of people do,
so keep that in mind.

190
00:09:43,760 --> 00:09:45,860
As you go to select your certification.

191
00:09:45,860 --> 00:09:48,770
All right, well if you're sticking
with us for the MCSA Windows 8,

192
00:09:48,770 --> 00:09:51,380
then I'll see you in the next episode.

193
00:09:51,380 --> 00:09:53,710
If not, browse the rest of
the certification collection.

194
00:09:53,710 --> 00:09:56,420
I think you'll find one certification or,
or more that are,

195
00:09:56,420 --> 00:09:58,880
are kind of more in line
with what your needs are.

196
00:09:58,880 --> 00:10:00,920
And if you can't determine where to start?

197
00:10:00,920 --> 00:10:05,360
Just ask, you can always shoot
an email to support@itpro.tv or

198
00:10:05,360 --> 00:10:07,030
email me at Don@itpro.tv.

199
00:10:07,030 --> 00:10:10,260
You'll probably get a faster response from
support, but just reach out to us and

200
00:10:10,260 --> 00:10:11,000
we'll help you.

201
00:10:11,000 --> 00:10:13,680
We can give you advice,
suggestions on where to start, you know,

202
00:10:13,680 --> 00:10:14,680
it's what we do here.

203
00:10:14,680 --> 00:10:18,332
So take advantage of that, we're,
we're always ready to answer questions.

204
00:10:18,332 --> 00:10:21,390
All right, well for those of you getting
ready to learn, we're about to start.

205
00:10:21,390 --> 00:10:24,641
For the rest of you,
good luck in your certification.

206
00:10:24,641 --> 00:10:30,750
[SOUND]

episodes.description: In this episode Don and Nate introduce us to the Windows 8 operating system. They take a few moments to discuss what is new in Windows 8 and run through a few installation scenarios.
episodes.title: Intro To Windows 8

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Don describe the hardware requirements of installing Windows RT on ARM-based processor devices. They emphasize features important to Windows 8.1 which have been improved including Hyper-V, Miracast Display and Secure Boot.
episodes.title: Hardware Requirements

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Don describe and demonstrate how to add additional feature to Windows 8.1 that may not be installed by default. They also demonstrate how to configure the OS to use an additional input language.
episodes.title: Additional Features

episodes.description: In this episode Nate and Ronnie take a look at configuring user profiles. They discuss and demonstrate roaming profiles, mandatory profiles, super-mandatory profiles and how to use the primary computers feature to restrict profile use.
episodes.title: Configuring User Profiles

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Don configure a domain user to use roaming profiles. They also explain the scenarios in which roaming profiles would be preferred over traditional local profiles.
episodes.title: Roaming Profiles

episodes.description: In this episode Nate and Don take a look at Windows Easy Transfer (WET), the User State Migration Tool (USMT), and Folder Redirection. These are all tools used to transfer a user's information between computers.
episodes.title: Migrating User Profiles

episodes.description: In this episode Nate and Don install, upgrade, and roll-back device drivers, as well as demonstrate how to locate the proper drivers for specific hardware.
episodes.title: Hardware and Apps Part 1

episodes.description: In this episode Nate and Don discuss application compatibility settings. They demonstrate creating application shims as well as side-loading Windows 8 modern style apps.
episodes.title: Hardware and Apps Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Nate demonstrate creating AppLocker rules as well as configuring access to hardware. They also discuss basic Internet Explorer features and how to configure them.
episodes.title: Hardware and Apps Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Nate demonstrate configuring Hyper-V. They show how to install the feature, create virtual machines, virtual switches, and virtual hard drives. The finish by discussing how to manage snapshots and exporting virtual machines.
episodes.title: Hardware and Apps Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Don discuss the use of signed and unsigned drivers and demonstrate how to install them. They also explain how to pre-stage drivers into the Windows 8.1 DriverStore.
episodes.title: Managing Drivers

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Don explore various ways of limiting the applications an end user can execute. They demonstrate software restriction policies as well as the new Assigned Access feature in Windows 8 which allow you to pick and choose the application an end user should be allowed to run.
episodes.title: Restricting Access

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Don take a look at the general settings in Internet Explorer 11 and discuss some of the commonly configured components. They also discuss some of the new issues that may arise from using a new browser and demonstrate techniques like Compatibility View which can be used to correct them.
episodes.title: Internet Explorer 11

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Don examine some of the new features added to Hyper-V in Windows 8.1. In particular they demonstrate moving virtual machine storage while the VM is online. They also explain what each of the integration services do and demonstrate how to individually enable and disable them.
episodes.title: Hyper-V New Features

episodes.description: In this episode Nate and Don tackle basic networking concepts in Windows 8. They take a look at assigning IPv4 and IPv6 address as well as basic troubleshooting.
episodes.title: Network Connectivity

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Nate delve into the world of network security. They cover Windows Firewall, IPSec policies and wireless security.
episodes.title: Network Security

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Nate explorer the tools and techniques used for remote management. They cover Remote Desktop, RSAT, WinRM/RS as well as Windows PowerShell.
episodes.title: Remote Management

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Don take a look at supporting users remotely with Remote Assistance and Easy Connect in Windows 8.1. They discuss the need, benefits and requirements of Remote Assistance in a business environment. They also demonstrate using Remote Assistance.
episodes.title: Remote Assistance

episodes.description: In this episode Nate and Don take a look at sharing folders and libraries as well as introduce the viewers to permissions and shared printing. They also explore using Homegroups to share data and do a quick examination of EFS.
episodes.title: Configure Shared Resources

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Nate take a look at NTFS permissions, disk quotas and object access auditing. They demonstrate the processes needed to configure various NTFS permissions and disk quotas as well as enabling and logging object access auditing.
episodes.title: File and Folder Access

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Nate dive into securing Windows 8 clients using local security policies and User Account Control. They also demonstrate configuring SmartScreen filters and enabling Secure Boot.
episodes.title: Local Security Settings

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Nate introduce us to the process of authenticating users and authorizing access. They also cover managing credentials and certificates with smart cards.
episodes.title: Authentication & Authorization

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Nate conclude their A&A discussion by covering biometrics as well as picture passwords and PIN. They also demonstrate setting up a Microsoft Account through Windows 8.
episodes.title: Authentication & Authorization Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Don explain user authentication in workgroups and domains. They talk about the differences and benefits between the two environments. They discuss the use of virtual smartcards for authentication and explain the benefits of keeping the User Account Control (UAC) enabled.
episodes.title: Authentication Methods

episodes.description: In this episode Nate and Mike take a look at configuring virtual private networks (VPN) and the technologies supporting remote access such as VPN Reconnect. They also demonstrate how to support a user through Remote Assistance.
episodes.title: Configure Remote Connections

episodes.description: In this episode Nate and Don take a look at mobility settings in Windows 8. They explore the differences between desktop and laptop systems and demonstrate some of the advanced features such as power management, offline files and drive encryption.
episodes.title: Mobility Options

episodes.description: In this episode Nate and Ronnie complete the 70-687 new objectives by tackling the last topic of using Windows 8.1 with Broadband Tethering.  They describe the use of broadband air cards and the native ability to do broadband tethering with 8.1 and they describe the ease of configuration.
episodes.title: Broadband Tethering

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don take a look at keeping a Windows 8 system healthy and optimized. They discuss regular updates and patching as well as storage redundancy mechanisms.
episodes.title: Maintaining Windows Part 1

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Nate wrap up maintaining Windows 8 by analyzing event logs and creating event subscriptions. They also demonstrate Task Manager, Reliability Monitor as well as optimizing indexing options.
episodes.title: Maintaining Windows Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Nate and Don take a look and backup and recovery. They show several different options for backing up individual files and entire systems and how to restore them when disaster strikes.
episodes.title: Backup and Recovery

episodes.description: In this ITProTV special Nate and Ronnie take a look at recovery features in Windows 8.1. They talk briefly about creating a recovery drive and partition, creating System Restore points and recovering files with Microsoft OneDrive (SkyDrive). They also show how to create a recovery drive, system restore points and recovering a file with OneDrive.
episodes.title: Recovery Options
